title: Best handheld system?
content:
Which is your favourite, or most desirable handheld system? My vote goes to the Nintendo DS. Despite it's technological shortcomings, I find it much more fun. The PSP's frustrating loading times, terrible UMD range, and dull games bored me to tears. (I only briefly sampled it at an electronic outlet)

Although the DS can definately use some more "mature" games though. Most games are aimed at a much younger audience, or are based on movies.-- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Nintendo DS:
content:
I didn't really like the fact that Nintendo DS made you play games with a stylus, I like that good, old gamepad feeling. I voted Gameboy Advanced.

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Nintendo DS:
content: You don't have to play DS games with a stylus - it still has the old gamepad and other buttons. The stylus is simply a different method of control.

title: Re: Nintendo DS:
content: It mainly depends on which game you play. I own 'The Urbz' which makes very little use of the touch screen whereas 'Nintendogs' relies mainly on the stylus. It just varies from game to game. Some games allow configuration between stylus and gamepad controls. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] -- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Re: Nintendo DS:
content:
I've tried none of those. I don't have enough money (to spend ot those) or interest.. Besides, are there even good games for those? Keens aren't ported. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
But admit, it would be cool to have one so could play for example in car or train, although I seldom use them.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] [url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

title: Walmart Tech isle:
content:
I just use the trial versions in the Walmart tech isle.

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Walmart Tech isle:
content:
Advanced and DS are equal to most people. I'll vote for the advanced because that's the only one I onw and I'm sure the DS will be as much entertaining. The PSP on the other is a consolle I'd not buy because as said before; up to this point there aren't much good PSP games released, it's way to expensive (don't forget that you need extra stuff too fur the full experience), and the consolle is not only made for the gaming but also for a lot of extra's and that's not a good thing for a handheld.-----------------
[img]http://jamba.nl/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Rocket.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: Re: Walmart Tech isle:
content:
The DS is pretty cool, but I'd go for the Gameboy Micro, which is basically a tiny GBA. I'm just getting into GBA programming, and would love to actually have one to run stuff on (as opposed to testing in an emulator and running on someone else's GBA when I get the chance).________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/YorpEye.png[/img]

title: Re: Walmart Tech isle:
content: Awesome. Would you mind sharing some games? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] -- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Re: Walmart Tech isle:
content:
Me? Not at all. There's a group at my school that I'm working with so I don't know how much I'll be producing independently, but if I do anything interesting I'll share it. I'd like to do a game in the Cosmic Osmo style for GBA, if I can make my storage requirements. Probably possible. I don't think I'll be doing much work on my own before I ge hardware to tun it on though, since half the fun is seeing your game on the handheld.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/YorpEye.png[/img]

title: Re: Walmart Tech isle:
content: Oh, and also Gameboy Micro is NOT backwards compatible. i.e. It can't play Gameboy or Gameboy Color games.-- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Re: Walmart Tech isle:
content:
I voted for GBA too. The DS seems a bit too gimmicky for my liking, and (to my knowledge) has no games that I'm really interested in.

And GBA has Golden Sun, so it gets an automatic win. =P
(Okay, okay, the DS can play Golden Sun. That's beside the point.)


I don't think the GBA Micro is a good idea, really - it seems like it'd be too small to play comfortably.[hr]

RocketJess, blasting off again!

[url=http://www.geocities.com/rocketjess]The Dragonkeeper's Lair[/url]

title: Re: Walmart Tech isle:
content: I dunno. I'm not so crazy about teeney tiny gadgets that can be broken and/or lost easily, but a lot of people are. Check out the iPod shuffle and the more recent iPod Nano. How much smaller can they get? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wormouth.gif[/img] -- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Wearable gadgets
content:
Actually once those things get small enough so you can carry them in your clothes without noticing them, I'll like them more.
It's annoying having to carry around stuff with you, but if everything is integrated into your jacket for instance, no more hassle.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Wearable gadgets
content: Gameboy Micro is backwards compatible

title: Re: Wearable gadgets
content:
No, it's not. It won't run GBC games.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/YorpEye.png[/img]

title: Re: Wearable gadgets
content: They wouldn't make it backwards compatible anyway as I believe MOST countries have discontinued selling GBC games. I've recently seen a couple of department stores still selling one or two GBC games but they were gone the next time I went there. And they were pretty darn expensive too.-- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Re: Best handheld system?
content:
i cant belive PSP got 1 vote, it should be ZERO. PSP 5UCKS, i returned mine the following day, i was FURIOUS---------
[img]http://img250.echo.cx/img250/9885/comicstrip9vf.gif[/img]

title: Re: Best handheld system?
content:
Actually I am the one who voted for the PSP, but only to try and annoy you! :P

No, seriously I voted without being hindered by too much knowledge about the systems in general, because I expect the PSP to have a wider variety of games.
When I think Nintendo I think Mario, Mario Kart, Tetris, mostly family games.
I suspect, but again, really don't know, the PSP to have more PC-like games as well.
I don't know it's just a mostly meaningless vote here anyway. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]
